intro: Lagascea latifolia, commonly known as the broadleaf lagascea, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States. It is a member of the Amaranthaceae family and is characterized by its broad, lance-shaped leaves and clusters of small, pinkish-white flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and thrives in full sun. It is often found in arid and semi-arid environments, showcasing its adaptability to harsh conditions. Due to its ornamental value and ecological importance, it is sometimes cultivated in gardens and restoration projects.
